ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard seeks advice...
ygData.msgSnippet: Caster s Realm already had a bard admin (Adres Tal).
ygData.messageBody:
Caster's Realm already had a bard admin (Adres Tal).

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2000 9:14 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard seeks advice...
>
>
> Caster's Realm is definitely the way to go if possible.
> Stratics has ben
> trying to rework their EQ site the last few months and so far
> I think all
> the changes are negative. They removed the only features I
> ever went there
> for, the Interactive Spell database and Item Database.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Greg Gillan [mailto:ggillan@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2000 10:13 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard seeks advice...
>
>
> Ask Castersrealm if they want to put it up. Those guys seem
> to be the most
> up to date on everything.
>
>
> Elwyn <Da`Kor>
> 54 Minstrel of Erollisi Marr
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2000 12:09 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard seeks advice...
>
>
>
> The only problem I have with it is that Stratics hasn't kept up at all
> on EQ, with a lot of their content and reference pages still unchanged
> since beta. As long as their hosting wasn't exclusive I guess
> there'd be
> no downside but it wouldn't be very good to see the song list locked
> away on a site that hardly anyone goes to due to it's mostly
> out of date
> info.
>
> Check their bard song list, hidden away under strategy and
> statistics(tm)->class articles->bard spell list. They have 20 songs.
> I guess it's nice that they are looking for a better list now but my
> question would be; why, after over a year of total neglect, are they
> bothering?
>
>
> On Tue, May 23/00, "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...> wrote:
> > I received an email last night from Manga of the EverQuest
> Stratics site.
> > They are interested in hosting the Song Analysis on their
> network. I
> > consider the Song Analysis to be not just mine, but all of
> yours as well.
> As
> > it would not be what it is without the combined wisdom of all the
> wonderful
> > bards on this mailing list and on the Concert Hall message
> board. Your
> > opinions on this matter mean a lot to me, so please let me
> know what your
> > feelings are.
>
> --
> Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
> GAT d- -p+(--) c++++ l++ u++ t- m--- W--- !v
> b+++ e* s-/+ n-(?) h++ f+g+ w+++ y*
>
>
>
